conclusion: To find the electric field strength at the intersection of the diagonals of the square.
The side length of the square is L.
The distance from each charge at the vertices to the center of the square is L/sqrt(2).
The electric field E due to a point charge q at a distance r is given by E = kq/r^2 * rÌ‚.
The field from charges at A and B will point away from these charges towards the center.
The field from charges at C and D will point towards these charges from the center.
Due to symmetry, the horizontal components of the fields from A and B will cancel each other out, as will the vertical components from C and D.
Each diagonal component has a magnitude of sqrt(2)kq/L^2.
The total electric field is 2 * sqrt(2)kq/L^2.
The resultant field points along the diagonal from A to C and from B to D.
The electric field strength at the intersection of the diagonals of the square is 2sqrt(2)kq/L^2 directed along the diagonal from the positive to the negative charges.
